oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mrs. Thomas Wells portrait
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sepia half-portrait of Mrs. Thomas Wells, carte de visite with decorative border. The The elderly woman is shown wearing a dark dress and bonnet. Oval photograph is decorated with swags and tassels and is topped with a fleur-de-lis.

Wife of Williamson County militia captain Thomas Wells who fought under Andrew Jackson in the Battle of New Orleans. During the War of 1812 women served on battlefields passing water to soldiers some disguised themselves and fought. They cooked, sewed, and served as nurse maids and scullery maids. Soldiers' wives could attend their husbands in camp through a lottery system.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: New Orleans, Battle of, New Orleans, La., 1815;Southern States--History--War of 1812;Louisiana--History--War of 1812
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Giers, C.C.
